summary: This is an email from an Assistant United States Attorney to attorney Sigrid McCawley regarding a motion filed by Ghislaine Maxwell's defense counsel. The motion seeks to subpoena information from the Epstein Victim Compensation Fund. The prosecutor informs McCawley of their intent to file a motion to quash the subpoena and proposes scheduling a call.

persons.name: Sigrid McCawley
persons.context: Recipient of the email from the AUSA, likely representing victims or opposing interests in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Her defense counsel filed a motion to subpoena information from the Epstein Victim Compensation Fund.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: Author of the email, informing Sigrid McCawley about Maxwell's motion and their intent to file a motion to quash the subpoena. Also discusses scheduling.

connections.description: The AUSA is communicating legal strategy and scheduling with attorney Sigrid McCawley regarding the Maxwell case.
The AUSA is opposing a motion filed by Maxwell's defense counsel and intends to file a motion to quash their subpoena.

events.title: Filing of Defense Motion for Subpoena
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell's counsel filed a motion seeking a court order to authorize a subpoena for information from the Epstein Victim Compensation Fund.

events.title: Prosecutor's Email Regarding Motion to Quash
events.description: An Assistant United States Attorney emails Sigrid McCawley to inform her of Maxwell's motion and their intent to file a motion to quash the subpoena later in the week.

locations: United States Attorney's Office Southern District of New York, One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team filed a motion on November 14, 2021, seeking to subpoena information from the Epstein Victim Compensation Fund.
The prosecution (AUSA) intends to file a motion to quash that subpoena.
The communication reveals ongoing legal maneuvering in the Maxwell case regarding access to victim compensation fund information.
The email is professional correspondence between a prosecutor and another attorney (Sigrid McCawley) regarding case strategy and scheduling.
